de.lambeck.pned.elements.data

Class DataTransition

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lambeck.pned.elements.data.DataElement
      • de.lambeck.pned.elements.data.DataNode
        • de.lambeck.pned.elements.data.DataTransition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDataElement, IDataNode, IDataTransition, IElement, INode, ITransition

    public class DataTransition
extends DataNode
implements IDataTransition
    Implements the transitions (squares) of the Petri net.
    Author:
    Thomas Lambeck, 4128320

      • resetEnabled

        public void resetEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: IDataTransition
        Resets the "enabled" and the "safe" state of this transition.

        Note: No Setter because "enabled" = true will be determined by method checkEnabled().
        Specified by:
        resetEnabled in interface IDataTransition

      • checkEnabled

        public boolean checkEnabled()
                     throws PNIllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: IDataTransition
        Checks whether this transition is enabled due to the state of all (previous) input and (following) output places. Stores and returns the result.

        A transition is enabled if:
        - It has at least one input place,
        - All input places have a token,
        - It has at least one output place,
        - Only output places that are input places as well have a token.

        Note: The transition in the Data model determines its state by itself, while the transition in the GUI model has a Setter for this state.
        Specified by:
        checkEnabled in interface IDataTransition
        Returns:
        True = transition enabled, false = transition disabled
        Throws:
        PNIllegalStateException - If this transition is not safe

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class DataNode

      • getPredPlaces

        public java.util.List<DataPlace> getPredPlaces()
        Description copied from interface: IDataTransition
        Returns a List of places (DataPlace) before the previous arrows (IDataArc). A transition can use this list to determine its own "enabled" state.

        Note: If the previous arcs have no predecessors (no places), the method returns null. But the IDataModelController should prevent this by removing all adjacent arcs when removing nodes.
        Specified by:
        getPredPlaces in interface IDataTransition
        Returns:
        List of all places before the predecessors (arcs)

      • getSuccPlaces

        public java.util.List<DataPlace> getSuccPlaces()
        Description copied from interface: IDataTransition
        Returns a List of places (DataPlace) behind the following arrows (IDataArc). A transition can use this list to determine its own "enabled" state.

        Note: If the following arcs have no successors (no places), the method returns null. But the IDataModelController should prevent this by removing all adjacent arcs when removing nodes.
        Specified by:
        getSuccPlaces in interface IDataTransition
        Returns:
        List of all places behind the successors (arcs)
